author: Elaine M. Avallone
title: Winter gala chases away winter blues | Jefferson County | nny360.com
text:
CARTHAGE — To chase away the winter blues and to bring a little sunshine, the 20th annual winter gala to benefit Augustinian Academy — “Hula in the Snow: A Winter Luau” — was held Feb. 10.
Talitha Workman, a member of the event planning committee, said 155 tickets were sold for the gala, which is one of the school’s most significant fundraisers with all funds going directly back to support the students of the school.
“People enjoyed the tropical theme, wearing bright colors and even flip flops, an attempt to beat the winter blues,” she said. “The meal was an all tropical flare with Hawaiian meats, grilled pineapple, SPAM and rice. We had tropical cocktails too at our tiki bar. The Patti Stanford Band all dressed in tropical attire and their first set of music was all brand new music they put together especially for our event — tropical country. They kicked off the entertainment portion of our evening with ‘Margaritaville,’ for which the Augustinian Academy staff had learned a line dance for.”
During the gala, former school principal Sister Annunciata Collins was honored for her 55 years of service to religious life and more than 20 years of service to Augustinian Academy. Current principal Sister Suanne Johnson, Sister of St. Joseph, and previous principal Mary Ann Margrey shared some stories and words to the attendees about Sister Aunnunciata and then she was given a fresh flower lei in the school colors.
In addition the members of the Knights of Columbus Father John Cosmic Council No. 291 were recognized for their service to Augustinian Academy and St. James church.
“We wish to pay homage to a remarkable group of men within our church whose unwavering commitment to giving mirrors the timeless legacy of King Kamehameha of Hawaii,” said Mrs. Workman. “In the spirit of King Kamehameha, who united the Hawaiian Islands through wisdom, strength and a deep love for his people we recognize these dedicated individuals standing before you. They exemplified the true essence of benevolence within our church community. Their acts of kindness, compassion, and selfless giving mirror the same spirit that King Kamehameha displayed in leading his people to prosperity and unity. Much like the king who prioritized the well-being of his subjects, these men of the church have dedicated their time, talents, and resources to uplift the lives of those around them.”
Mrs. Workman pointed out the many deeds both physically and financially the Knight have done for the school and church including renovation projects, fundraising, the purchase of equipment and aiding with the St. James Fair.
The Knights were each presented with a symbolic crown lapel pin.
Awards were presented for best dressed in the theme and other fun categories.
Garry Stevens won the “Cheeseburger in Paradise” award for Most-Laid Back and Carefree Spirit. He was awarded a platter of cheeseburgers
Jim and Lucie Cassoni were awarded “Hula Hotties” for best dressed couple and won a Hawaiian dashboard Hula dancer.
Debbie Kepler won the “Golden Pineapple” award for spending the most money at the silent auction. She was awarded a solid gold pineapple — a fresh pineapple spray painted gold.
Mrs. Workman expressed thanks to the donors of the larger raffle prizes provided by Aubuchon Hardware, providing a grill, and Cross-Tracks Archery, providing a crossbow. In addition, she also expressed thanks to the major sponsors — Carthage Area Hospital, Robert Sligar with CrossCountry Mortgage, The Sisters of St. Joseph, Fuller Insurance Agency, The Knights of Columbus Father John Cosmic Council No. 291 and Iseneker Funeral Home.
“Many other area businesses supported our silent auction with items and gift certificates and donated to our gala through sponsorships,” she pointed out.
Johnson Newspapers 7.1

author: Vanesa Soto
title: Los 8 Días de Oro de El Corte Inglés desploman el precio de la chaqueta The North Face impermeable que nos va a salvar el otoño
text: La DANA y las fuertes tormentas están despidiendo este mes de forma demasiado catastrófica siendo algo que nadie nos esperábamos. Siempre es bueno estar preparados para este tipo de situaciones y los abrigos impermeables son la mejor compra ya que nos mantienen secos además de calentitos como este modelo. Se trata del abrigo The North Face Descendit en color amarillo totalmente impermeable y hecho con materiales resistentes. The North Face - Chaqueta Descendit para hombre The North Face. La chaqueta enemiga de la lluvia Ahora puedes conseguirlo rebajado en los 8 Días de Oro de El Corte Inglés por solo[ 209,99 euros](https://www.vitonica.com/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elcorteingles.es%2Fdeportes%2FMP_0538405_NF0A4QWW-chaqueta-descendit-para-hombre-the-north-face%2F%3FparentCategoryId%3D999.14598528013%26color%3DAmarillo&category=ecommerce&ecomPostExpiration=everlasting&postId=70421) 299,99 euros. Esta chaqueta está confeccionada en tejido de poliéster reciclado 100% responsable con el medio ambiente que incorpora la tecnología impermeable y transpirable DryVent que resiste las rachas de aire más fuertes manteniendo el cuerpo seco de la lluvia. Además, está acolchado con relleno térmico que mantiene el calor corporal con doble capa y costuras selladas. Entre sus elementos principales podemos destacar los ajustes de velcro en los puños, la cremallera central, capucha trasera, bolsillos y ajuste en el bajo con elástico. Las tallas van desde S a XL y puedes encontrarla también en otros colores como en verde. Nota: algunos de los enlaces aquí publicados son de afiliados y pueden reportar un beneficio. author: Reuters
title: Israel Hamas War, Israel Gaza War, Netanyahu Says At Least 13,000 Terrorists Among Palestinians Killed
text:
Source: NDTV News | Title: Netanyahu Says At Least 13,000 \”Terrorists\” Among Palestinians Killed
<!–
–> “We are very close to victory,” said Netanyahu (File)
Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has told a German newspaper that at least 13,000 “terrorists” were among Palestinians killed during Israel’s air and ground assault on Gaza.
Five months into Israel’s campaign following the October 7 Hamas-led attack on southern Israel, Palestinian health authorities say nearly 31,000 Palestinians have been killed.
The Gaza health ministry does not break down the death count between civilians and Hamas operatives but has said that 72% of those killed were women and children. Hamas dismisses Israeli figures for militants killed as attempts to portray “fake victories”.
In an interview with Germany’s Bild newspaper, Netanyahu was quoted as saying that an extension of Israel’s offensive into Rafah in southern Gaza was key to defeating Hamas.
“We are very close to victory … Once we begin military action against the remaining terror battalions in Rafah, it is only a question of weeks” until the intensive phase of fighting is concluded, he said.
Three quarters of Hamas battalions had been destroyed and halting the offensive now would only allow them to regroup, Bild quoted Netanyahu as saying.
Bild made excerpts of the interview, which was jointly held with Politico and German broadcaster Welt TV, available to Reuters on Sunday.
(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
Read More | Source: NDTV News
